intro: Stylidium laricifolium, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals and bright red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as heaths and woodlands. Its unique morphology includes a short, erect stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Stylidium laricifolium is adapted to arid conditions and plays an important role in its native ecosystems.
